author: cmpilato
msg: Locking branch: Remember that LOCKNULLs-in-PROPFINDs support has been
done before.
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/repos.c
(dav_svn_walk): Leave a little note for future coders that the
LOCKNULL problem has already been solved.

author: cmpilato
msg: Locking branch: Revert revisions r13459 and r13473, in which
mod_dav_svn learned how to show LOCKNULLs in PROPFINDs of depth 1 or
greater.
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/repos.c
(dav_svn_walker_context): Lose 'locks' member.
(is_immediate_child): Remove.
(dav_svn_do_walk, dav_svn_walk): No longer do lock-y stuff.

author: philip
msg: * STATUS: Vote for r12904 and 1.1.x-new-swig and move both to approved.

author: cmpilato
msg: Locking branch: Fix the broken LOCKNULL revelation code, and optimize
it too so that performance in depth-1 PROPFINDs is better than before,
and depth-infinity performance actually improves over the course of
the full tree walk.
Of course, this code is destined to be either disabled or removed in
just a few minutes.  I just wanted to make it work so that if we ever
needed to revive this functionality, it'd be ready to go.
* subversion/mod_dav_svn/repos.c
(get_immediate_children_locks): Removed.
(is_immediate_child): New.  ### This really could be an svn_path.h func
(dav_svn_do_walk): Remove locks from the hash that we don't care
about as we find out we don't care so that a) when we have to go
play pathmath games, there are potentially fewer locks to fuss
with, and b) we don't have to cover this same ground again as/if
recursion continues deeper.

author: sussman
msg: * notes/locking/TODO.txt:  clarify strategy for lock-nulls.
